attributes.comment:
USCIS has been passing blame on FBI for being slow on the Name check process for
Immigrants applying for Green Card (I-485). Even though it is understandable
that FBI name/security check is an important step that needs careful review,
it is taking ridiculously long for most, if not all, applicants. USCIS has to
guarantee that FBI name check process will get resolved within a certain
time-frame to justify the fee increase. USCIS has to stop passing the blame on
FBI for name check delays. As the Green card (I-485) applications are being
receieved by USCIS, USCIS is the agency which is responsible for timely
adjudication of the applications received by it. So, this fee increase should be
done only after USCIS guarantees that Name check process will "Not only be
speeded up " but also should be some "Quantitative" statement like " FBI
name/secuirty check will be completed with X months"

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
